description: A growth hacker asks LocaleGen Pro for a concise Dutch push notification, the bot retrieves Dutch tone guidelines, translates the source copy, looks up glossary terms, checks tone, validates a 45‑character limit, generates the final asset, and stores it in the CMS.

messages.content: You are LocaleGen Pro, an AI‑powered Content Localization Bot. Your job is to turn source marketing copy into region‑specific assets by using cultural guidelines, glossaries, tone analysis, length validation, and then store the final copy in the company's CMS. Use the provided tools to fulfil user requests.
I need a short push notification for our spring sale in the Netherlands, max 45 characters, informal but brand‑friendly.
Let me fetch the Dutch cultural and tone guidelines for the Netherlands.

{"guidelines_text":"In Dutch push notifications, keep the tone friendly, slightly informal, and use direct imperatives. Avoid overly formal language. Prefer short sentences and emojis only when brand‑appropriate. Character limit includes spaces and punctuation."}
Now I will translate the source copy into Dutch.

arguments.source_text: Spring Sale! Get 20% off on all items. Shop now!

messages.content: {"translated_text":"Lente Sale! Ontvang 20% korting op alle artikelen. Shop nu!"}
I'll look up any domain‑specific terms in the glossary to ensure consistent terminology.
Next, I will evaluate the translated text against the Dutch guidelines.

arguments.text: Lente Sale! Ontvang 20% korting op alle artikelen. Shop nu!
arguments.guidelines_text: In Dutch push notifications, keep the tone friendly, slightly informal, and use direct imperatives. Avoid overly formal language. Prefer short sentences and emojis only when brand‑appropriate. Character limit includes spaces and punctuation.

messages.content: {"tone_feedback":"The word 'Sale' is too English‑centric. Replace with 'aanbieding'. The sentence 'Ontvang 20% korting op alle artikelen.' is a bit long for a push. Consider a shorter, more direct phrasing. Overall tone is friendly but could be slightly more informal."}
I will now adjust the translation for tone and length, then validate the 45‑character limit.
All checks passed. I will generate the final localized asset using the corrected translation, glossary substitutions, tone feedback, and length validation.

arguments.source_text: Spring Sale! Get 20% off on all items. Shop now!
arguments.translated_text: Lente Sale! Ontvang 20% korting op alle artikelen. Shop nu!
arguments.tone_feedback: Replace 'Sale' with 'aanbieding', shorten sentence, use slightly informal tone.

messages.content: Finally, I will store the localized push notification in the CMS.

✅ Your Dutch push notification is ready and stored: **Lenteaanbieding: 20% korting! Shop nu!**
You can view it here: https://cms.company.com/assets/spring_sale_push_nl
The copy is 39 characters long, follows Dutch informal tone guidelines, and respects the 45‑character limit.
